8D129BCD58F6498BB237C66A6120CB2D.description:
Apply responsible legal and ethical behaviors in
the use of technology systems and software.

DCDB138984CD4E4CAA1B5C4EBAC578CC.description:
Use a variety of productivity technology tools to
collaborate with others, manage projects, collect
and analyze data, share information, and/or
publish findings.

6CB2E612951B4F6CA6283A2B674B93CC.description:
Apply strategies for identifying and solving
routine hardware and software problems.

3267E1E859344B278DDD22B34570444B.description:
Design, use, and evaluate computational
abstractions that model the state and behavior
of real-world problems and physical systems.

05C482BDA3D245D1849E15986B0DD026.description:
Use a programming language to develop
solutions to problems and/or accomplish tasks.

838C52A512174C59A966B808E471A2C1.description:
Decompose a complex problem or system into
parts.

F19447DB98C247A088FEE1C969690EF9.description:
Computational Thinking and Computer Science Applications - Students will be able to apply computational thinking skills and computer science
applications as tools to develop solutions to engineering problems.

5E2B2C471BD84AFFBC61A29F9DA73939.description:
Analyze the steps in the construction process
(preparing the site; setting foundations;
building the framework; enclosing the
structure; installing utilities; finishing the
interior and exterior; completing the site).

B7E19AD4D7C043A1B2655C75C66FF8EC.description:
Examine the need for maintenance, alteration,
or renovation to improve structures or to alter
their intended use (STL, 20M).

0B52AAA9219A40BD91DE0A16B6CFBF96.description:
Analyze factors used to guide the process of
designing and making structures.

368C010DC7254DBEB69D6389D28BE9D5.description:
Analyze the various materials and systems that
comprise buildings.

3D59E6A986C94F0F877F898E40167B53.description:
Analyze the physical infrastructures that allow a
society or government to function (e.g.
infrastructures of roads, airports, dams, canals,
rail lines, sewers).

A70A89CDB70348F0BB01881FAB3BA37B.description:
Design and create models of a variety of
structures.

4EBD270351CE4D1BA8C493C03FA2EEA6.description:
Apply marketing techniques to build awareness
of a manufactured product.

8E5B2737FFBA4400B6D0AE69D4241E26.description:
Examine the need for and application of
terotechnology in manufacturing.

8338764836DA401FAAF7FFC4901A8B2E.description:
Explore the life cycle costing of products in a
manufacturing process.

1338AC323FAD444A889B410416D5A701.description:
Analyze the life cycle of a manufactured
product.

150A2F2624C94A6CACAB82E36096FBE4.description:
Classify materials as natural, synthetic, or mixed
(STL, 19M).

86A5FF1BE24548E19ADDC721872EE5A6.description:
Create machine code to manufacture a
product.

2FF82CF451E04C0481CC1FDE996D5906.description: Design and develop an interchangeable part.

96591678D801404B9680DEBC19183508.description:
Classify manufacturing systems as being
customized production, batch production, or
continuous production.

DA14972441254CE79CEFF6AA0AEA2B30.description:
Describe mechanical processes that change the
form of materials (separating, forming,
combining, and conditioning).

6A440AF66FD54CEE8F92CDB5B68B91EA.description:
Analyze manufacturing processes (designing,
development, producing, and servicing).

6AA76562492F46ACA732DBEAA7D44994.description:
Investigate and propose solutions to issues
associated with transportation such as cost,
safety, environmental impact, energy, and
government regulations.

25318A8BDC8B4ACEBCCC954B0DBAC48A.description: Analyze intermodal travel of people and goods.

59375228B02A48F5B9F151B5F364E2CC.description:
Assess the role of transportation in
manufacturing, construction, communication,
health, safety, recreation, entertainment, and
agriculture.

742E2EC0B2424EDC8CACC8D0F61C3C9A.description:
Design, use, and assess various types of
information and communication systems (e.g.
graphic, optical, radio, tactical).

33C38B3612DB4715AB18C014010F912C.description:
Analyze factors that influence messages (e.g.
timing, sequencings, processing).

5684FF85B11D4A00B2E0CC892E6D01D7.description:
Demonstrate the transfer of information
through different communication systems.

24717A989F8E42A2AC90D56A8577D6BB.description:
Analyze the function and application of
different forms of communication technologies
(e.g. internet, wireless networks).

A24D854A910C42DDB8018AE9B32C8767.description:
Assess approaches to reduce noise and
promote clear communication.

ED9EE94762274C5BB8BB4D67DFEE0675.description:
Investigate components of a communication
system (STL, 17O).

4D768EF5BEC84430A4931B17C9FC542E.description:
Analyze the inputs, processes, and outputs
associated with sending and receiving
information (STL, 17I).

E3453419141D4754AD7C5322A20103FA.description:
Design, build, and refine a device that works
within given constraints to convert one form of
energy into another form of energy (HS-PS3-3).

3736251C304D45358346CEEAC051F103.description:
Create computational models to calculate the
change in the energy of one component in a
system when the change in the energy of the
other component(s) an energy flows in and out
of the system are known (HS-PS3-1).

35E787CDE6E74B95B0A552450F331AD7.description:
Assess energy efficiency at generation,
distribution, and point of use.

73A4A831B8FC45E1A76C205A129180ED.description: Analyze energy inputs, processes and outputs.

FAEC599EFDCE4A0885F2D21E285CB1CD.description:
Analyze the production, conversion,
transmission, and application of different forms
of energy (e.g. mechanical, radiant, chemical,
thermal, electrical, nuclear).

83BA056AD40B4C4BACB69B5B5B89FAC9.description:
Assess the application and impacts of
biotechnology on other fields of study such as
bioinformatics, bioprocess engineering, and
biorobotics.

232A3017EF7C475DAD9A1597940CE81C.description:
Assess the ethical, social, and legal issues
regarding the use of biotechnology (e.g. genetic
engineering).

1C052EC7413446BC86D00DBF32137B75.description:
Analyze the application of biotechnology
processes and products in medicine,
agriculture, food processing, and the
environment.

D9B4701A737341359264C44D07207880.description:
Examine the social side effects and trade-offs of
using various technologies in the production of
food.

A315FC43117D41309F55060CD4988FB4.description:
Assess the need for regulations governing
technologies used in agriculture.

C2B9522528D545DF8B3F9187C8DCDA06.description:
Assess the products and systems used to
produce, process, and distribute food, fiber,
fuel, chemical, and other products (STL, 16K).

AA191EC72BEC4B69AB8144E12FBFAC1B.description:
Analyze how advancement in technology has
improved the yield and quality of food.

976DC73B76F24968B880DB3B7C0E47CE.description:
Assess how advances in medical technology
have improved the health of multicellular
organisms (e.g. reducing the instances of
serious diseases in humans).

EFB1517E56514F71B2939D8C30759BB2.description:
Analyze ethical issues and global concerns
surrounding the development, access,
application, and effects of health and medical
technologies.

EC1AC3C167DB4B25B7712BA88C2E8A4C.description:
Investigate the benefits and consequences of
advances in medicine made through the use of
technology.

67CC1EFB4CB3416987E637697571131C.description:
Employ trends, research, and forecasting
techniques to analyze emerging health and
medical technologies.

3D1CC50BCBEF4749848921449A023FDF.description:
Core Technologies and The Designed World - Students will demonstrate knowledge of the core technologies that underpin the designed world and
major enterprises that produce the goods and services of the designed world. Core technologies include but are not limited to biotechnology, electrical, electronics,
fluid, material, mechanical, optical, structural, and thermal technologies. Major enterprises include medical, agriculture, biotechnology, energy and power,
information and communication, transportation, and manufacturing and construction technologies.

51355D3922FE497894F63245792307AC.description:
Apply knowledge of core technologies in the
development of solutions to problems.

7805D901C62E40F79EB51BA24ACFFA07.description:
Apply the research and development problem-solving approach to prepare devices and
systems for the marketplace.

20552AA71CC44683BB8163980B00A86E.description: Assess the validity of a research results.

21559F927DFD4E1E9728935924DF557D.description: Engage in failure analysis and optimization.

FDF7552EEF7246A0BADB1EF889719B10.description:
Apply assessment techniques (e.g. trend
analysis) to determine if a solution should be
pursued to design and development.

595999A99D514E929B0F72A56051869B.description:
Identify the capital and other resources needed
to develop solutions to problems.

96E2AEAABAC84E5CA6B2AAFEE80416E6.description:
Assess how design requirements such as
criteria, constraints, and efficiency can compete
with each other (STL, 8K).

4DDC6367C66749BA881E8841A37DBF20.description:
Evaluate design solutions using software and
other tools to develop conceptual, physical, and
mathematical models at various intervals of the
design process in order to ensure compliance
with design requirements (STL, 11P).

699F80B43151462AA58598384E8FA0AC.description:
Apply design principles (e.g. flexibility, balance,
function, proportion) to evaluate existing
designs, to collect data, and to guide the design
process (STL, 9I).

911832C7983949A48CCDC199585864E9.description:
Assess the reliability and validity of researched
information.

5E6B003179974AD69BB1522C39F3338F.description:
Document the design process and solutions in a
journal, notebook, or portfolio.

C42F2A51C97B4B199D3389A1BA62405B.description:
Apply the design process to develop solutions to
real-world problems.

3D506DDC336A4814A981B934212C5818.description:
Engineering Design and Development - Students will demonstrate knowledge of and apply the engineering design process to develop solutions to
problems.

7990ECADD5F5478A8ADF403F13F9C4EB.description:
Draw connections between technological
advances and evolution of civilization
through different archaeological periods
(e.g. stone age, bronze age, iron age) (STL,
4H).

7C55936184E043C78322CCD8E48E7935.description:
Compare and contrast the development,
availability, and application of technology in
developed and underdeveloped countries.

6E718F81395F426EB56DF0ADF3FF576E.description:
Analyze how different cultures develop their
own technologies to satisfy their individual
and shared needs, wants, and values.

667BC03EBB4E4B2FBE9CC3A0C13DF905.description:
Distinguish factors that affect the scaling of
technology.

904ABB4D5238429F9788AD7F8885E0FA.description:
Role of Society in the Development and Use of
Technology

0032167F2C524AE4A51EB797965B9363.description:
Create and design a product to mitigate the
undesirable consequences of an existing
technology.

481819D0E0D04987B8482291ED0DAAC8.description:
Design a forecasting technique to evaluate the
results of altering natural systems (STL, 13M).

600AEC96928D44108E38013840AE7683.description:
Analyze the relationship between technological
and natural systems.

C9ADA7517023460C913A374F1A2940FD.description:
Analyze legal and ethical considerations in the
development and application of technology.

1F3566A419FE4043BE85FFB7903E3CAB.description:
Apply assessment techniques, such as trend
analysis and experimentation, to make
decisions about the future development of
technology (STL, 13L).

C1A7EAF5D1924639898D6A9B23912D94.description:
Evaluate the desirable and undesirable
consequences of technological advancements.

947A184F3BB44E89B52B6B0ED8B59E38.description: Impacts of Technology - Students will evaluate the impact of technology.

EFFE5732195247FA8117B80B36C63846.description:
Differentiate between open source and
proprietary technology.

8B1DD44348B74CE797517D8FB5717A07.description:
Assess ways to protect intellectual property (e.g.
patent, trademark, copyright).

E33FCD75CEA047A884721CE1EFCE888A.description:
Analyze the purpose and functionality of subject
matter (SMEs) on a team.

7488A3C475D74F999154467FBFE820D1.description:
Correlate technological advances to progress in
other fields of study such as science and
mathematics (STL, 3J).

9F18FD64CE1C4F54AD388CFA7FBE7FCB.description:
Connections Between Technology and Other Fields
of Study

045EF9D40085420882E8A9849A2832EF.description:
Demonstrate how trade-offs can impact a design
product.

2E055836D3D34835A2546B997A10509E.description: Create a model of a feedback control system.

C56D95C9671741A7A6AB6BB7505AEC4B.description:
Troubleshoot, analyze, and maintain systems to
ensure safe and proper function and precision.

F8CEDC2300B041A48C4998934677E6D0.description:
Diagnose a system that is malfunctioning and
use tools, materials, and knowledge to repair it
(STL, 12M).

C85BEEA833974952A98AD6C39A8DB09F.description:
Assemble and operate simple and complex
systems.

FBCFA491EC814E9EB2E255B9893ADDF8.description:
Employ constraint-based modeling to describe a
biological system.

CA00AB27D7964A7B8BBBD22D6B0F90C8.description:
Use mathematical models and/or computer
simulations to predict the effects of a design
solution on systems and/or the interaction
between systems (HS-ETS 1-4).

DD30617403594684B007F1306DAF0003.description:
Analyze how technology can be repurposed for
applications beyond their intended use.

09AE53FF490A42AEBB9D50BFEAA559E3.description:
Analyze the functionality and interaction of
various technological systems.

1521613151EE47D5BC32943278507EE3.description:
Assess the effects of technology on supply and
demand.

2A8836A7108849F09800D6AA0B2BE0E5.description:
Describe factors that may limit the development
or use of technology (e.g. resources, societal
concerns).

DDA166D2FEF044DF9E5F47679084B9A8.description:
Analyze factors that drive technological
invention and innovation.

6D9A75B3B0BC480299B296B05BC1EA9C.description: The Nature of Technology - Students will develop an understanding of the nature of technology.
